(1) No heir is bound to fulfil in their entirety legacies whose value exceeds the value of that portion of the inherited property which the testator was able to dispose of freely.
(2) The same applies to a legatee when the value of the legacies or obligations he or she is to fulfil exceeds the value of his or her legacy.
(3) In the above cases, all legacies and obligations shall be reduced in equal proportions, unless the testator has determined otherwise.
